title: About me
text:
University of Malaya | Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
B.Sc. in Physics | Sept 2019 – Mac 2023





Apecia | Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia | May 2024 – Present
Machine Learning & Data Science

Designed and maintained end-to-end MLOps workflows using MLflow for experiment tracking and MinIO + PostgreSQL for artifact and metadata storage

Developed an anomaly detection system for time-series production data, reducing SPC violations and defect rates through early warning insights

Researched and experimented with physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) using NVIDIA’s physics simulation frameworks to support digital twin modeling

AI & Model Deployment

Deployed Large Language Models (LLMs) using Triton Inference Server on NVIDIA Jetson edge devices, enabling low-latency inference in resource-constrained environments

Built a multi-agent AI system using LangGraph and LangChain to summarize operational data via internal client-server communication

DevOps & Automation

Implemented CI/CD pipelines using Gitea Actions, self-hosted runners, and Docker to automate deployment of an internal knowledge base

Containerized services using Docker for reproducible and environment-agnostic deployments across development and production

Infrastructure & System Engineering

Automated RKE2 Kubernetes cluster deployment across three nodes with Ansible, cutting setup time by 90% and enabling scalable ML model hosting

Provisioned disposable Linux VMs using Proxmox VE to support rapid experimentation and model training at scale

Maintained Linux servers with a focus on least privilege principle, including user account management, file permissions, and system access control

Knowledge Management & Graph Systems

Integrated a Neo4j graph database into the internal knowledge base, centralizing technical documentation and enabling faster data discovery

Managed and versioned codebases across GitHub and Gitea, following Git best practices for collaboration and release management





Dah Reply AI | Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia | Oct 2023 – Jan 2024

Developed a chatbot spam‑detection system using the LangChain framework, reducing manual moderation.

Built a Python module for an LLM‑powered chatbot agent, boosting customer engagement.

title: Joining Codecrafters!
text:
One day, while watching a YouTube video from one of my favorite creators, I came across a sponsored segment. I usually skip these parts, but this time I did not because the promoted content really caught my attention.
The platform being promoted was called CodeCrafters. It is a place to sharpen your programming skills by building real-world projects, step by step.
I have tried platforms like HackerRank and LeetCode before. While those platforms are great for learning core programming logic, I often found myself wondering, “Why am I doing this? Just to pass interviews?” With CodeCrafters, my first impression was different. Instead of solving disconnected puzzles, you build real systems—like creating an HTTP server from scratch.
After trying a few challenges, I can say I really enjoy it. Not only does it improve my programming skills, but it also helps me understand how things work under the hood. Finally, I get the feeling of “Ohh, so this is why I am doing this.”
I liked it so much that I decided to subscribe for a full year (big thanks to my company for sponsoring it!). And now, the adventure begins.
I will be tracking my progress in real time—check it out here!
